content: simple kippah this simple kippah can be made with a stripe as pictured or in a solid color the yarns listed are the ones i used for the pictured example you can use any similar-weight fingering approx 30g per 100m yarn you will want to make sure you have a very small tapestry/finishing needle for weaving in ends because this pattern makes for a very tight fabric my usual tapestry needle was comically large size this kippah is sized to fit most adults to make a slightly smaller version you can leave off a few row fiber main color la jolla baah yarn color mix and mingle 400yds = 115g i e 100m = 31g contrasting color optional lang yarn regina color 1093 50g = 175m i e 100m = 29g tools f hook xs tapestry needle for weaving in ends directions this pattern is worked in the round beginning with a magic_ring if you ve never done a magic_ring before i recommend looking up a video it s very easy once you know what you re doing key to notation and symbols single_crochet single_crochet * repeat *portion described between single_crochet# single_crochet #
